Class GameLoopManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.managers.GameLoopManager
public class GameLoopManager extends Object
Manages the core game loop and timing mechanics.

This class uses JavaFX Timeline animations to generate "ticks" at intervals defined by the current game level. It acts as the heartbeat of the game, triggering gravity events that move pieces down.

Responsibilities include:

  • Managing the main game loop timer.
  • Handling start, pause, resume, and stop states.
  • Executing the "Countdown" sequence before a game begins.
  • Adjusting tick speed dynamically based on the level.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLoopManager

      public GameLoopManager(Runnable onTickAction, javafx.scene.control.Label countdownLabel)
      Constructs a new GameLoopManager.
      Parameters:
      onTickAction - the Runnable to execute every game tick (typically moving the active piece down).
      countdownLabel - the UI label used to display the "3, 2, 1, GO!" sequence.

  • Method Details

    • initGameLoop

      public void initGameLoop()
      Initializes the game loop with the starting speed defined in GameConfiguration. The timeline is created but not started until the countdown finishes.

    • createTimeline

      private javafx.animation.Timeline createTimeline(long speedMillis)
      Creates a new JavaFX Timeline for the specified speed.
      Parameters:
      speedMillis - interval in milliseconds between ticks.
      Returns:
      a configured Timeline with indefinite cycle count.

    • startGame

      private void startGame()
      Internal method to actually begin the game loop after the countdown is complete.

    • togglePause

      public void togglePause()
      Toggles the pause state of the game loop.

      If the game is currently counting down or already over, this method does nothing. When paused, the timeline stops; when resumed, it continues from where it left off.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Stops the game loop permanently and marks the state as Game Over.

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Resets the manager state for a new game session.

      Stops any running timelines, resets flags, sets speed back to Level 1, and initiates the countdown sequence.

    • updateLevel

      public void updateLevel(int level)
      Updates the game loop speed based on the current level.

      It retrieves the target speed from GameConfiguration. If the speed has changed, the current timeline is stopped and replaced with a new one running at the faster rate.

      Parameters:
      level - the current game level (1-based index).

    • showCountdown

      public void showCountdown()
      Starts the visual "3, 2, 1, GO!" countdown sequence.

      This blocks the main game loop from starting until the animation finishes. It uses a secondary Timeline to update the countdown label every second.

    • isPauseProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty isPauseProperty()

    • isGameOverProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty isGameOverProperty()

    • isCountingDownProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty isCountingDownProperty()
